title: Weekly Stand-up Meetings
description: Essential phrases for daily stand-up meetings in tech companies

cards.front: How to say you'll finish a task by Friday?
cards.back: I'll have it completed by Friday.
cards.phonetic: aɪl hæv ɪt kəmˈpliːtɪd baɪ ˈfraɪdeɪ
cards.example: For the Q3 report, I'll have it completed by Friday.

cards.front: How to report progress on a project?
cards.back: I'm making good progress on the project.
cards.phonetic: aɪm ˈmeɪkɪŋ ɡʊd ˈprəʊɡres ɒn ðə ˈprɒdʒekt
cards.example: I'm making good progress on the project. We should finish by next week.
cards.hint: Use present continuous for ongoing actions

author: BridgyAI Team

title: Email Writing Basics
description: Common phrases for professional email communication

cards.front: How to start a formal email?
cards.back: Dear [Name], I hope this email finds you well.
cards.phonetic: dɪə neɪm aɪ həʊp ðɪs ˈiːmeɪl faɪndz juː wel
cards.example: Dear Mr. Smith, I hope this email finds you well.
cards.hint: Use formal greeting for business emails

author: BridgyAI Team
